p: Figure 3b presents the electrical conductivities ( σ) as a function of temperature, where the σ values increase with the increase of the temperature, but they slightly decrease as the x value increases. At 725 K, the σ value of the sample at x = 0.15 reaches the highest (8.56 × 10 2 Ω −1m −1), and then it decreases to 5.15 × 10 2 Ω −1m −1 at 814 K.
